She will use this loan to invest in buying firewood, chemicals to make air fresheners, gas, etc. Her business has grown as before she only sold air fresheners and now she has diversified her products to include things such as firewood, carbon, gas, etc. 

Denise has been selling fried foods from her house for the past three years, Maryuri sells cds and videos wholesale to department stores and also retail.

loans.use: to buy firewood, chemicals to make air fresheners, gas, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sodas, groceries and tables.

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es: Angela es una microempresaria que se dedica a comercializar mercadería en general, cosméticos de la Avon, ropa interior desde hace varios años, tuvo crédito en grupo solidarios se promueve a la metodología individual por su record crediticio, ella misma atiende su negocio. Trabaja medio tiempo en una clínica para mejorar sus ingresos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa nueva variada, cosméticos de la Avon y ropa interior.
texts.en: Angela is a micro-businesswoman who has made a living selling general merchandise, Avon cosmetics and underwear for the past few years. She received a loan as part of a solitary group but now is applying for an individual one due to her excellent credit history. She attends her business herself. She also works part time in a clinic to improve her income. She will invest this loan in buying a variety of new clothes, Avon cosmetics and underwear.

loans.use: to buy Avon cosmetics, underwear and a variety of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nuevas Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nuevas Emprendedoras, ha trabajo arduamente por salir adelante y gracias a su trabajo está en su octavo ciclo. Una de estas mujeres es la Sra. Maria Antonia, quien vende todo tipo de comidas, cuenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela ya que sus alimentos son muy ricos.
Maria Sueña con seguir creciendo y trabajando, y solicita el préstamo para la compra de carnes, condimentos, verduras  y demás.
Todas las miembros están muy agradecidas por la oportunidad que estan recibiendo, pues les sera de gran ayuda en todo lo que ellas están haciendo.
texts.en:
The group "Nuevas Emprendedoras" [New Entrepreneurs] has worked hard to get ahead and thanks to their hard work are in their eighth loan cycle. 

One of these women is Maria Antonia, who sells all kinds of food. She mentions that she has acquired a very good clientèle as her food is very tasty.
Maria dreams of continuing to grow and work and she is requesting this loan to buy meat, condiments, vegetables and other items.

All the members of this group are very grateful for this opportunity they are receiving as it is of great help to them in all they are doing.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables and other food stuffs.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su ciclo número doce, y con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante y se ayudan las unas a las otras. Una de ellas es la Sra. María quien se dedica a la venta de comidas dulces y saladas en forma ambulante. Cuenta la Sra. María solicita el crédito para la compra de productos para elaborar las comidas, como ser carnes, condimentos, harina, huevos y demás.
Ella se encuentra  muy agradecida ya que gracias al apoyo que se grupo está saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
This group is requesting their twelfth  loan. With much effort and sacrifice the group is getting ahead and they help each other out. 

One of the members is María who makes a living selling both sweet and savory foods on the street. María says that she is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making her food such as meat, spices, flour, eggs, and other things. 

She is very grateful because thanks to the support of her group, she is getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy meat, flour, eggs, and other things.

loans.name: Etoile Group

texts.fr: La cliente Djuma est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Etoile,  âgée de 47 ans, veuve, mère de 7 enfants. Seulement  1 enfant qui étudie, 4 n’étudient pas faute de moyens financiers et  deux autres ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Son mari fut décède suite d’une maladie inopinée.  Elle est vendeuse de boissons (bière Primus et Fanta) à son domicile. Il ya 25 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle  démarra son business  avec son fonds propre. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de base de l’IMF  Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec 10 casiers de Primus, 5 casiers de Fanta,etc. Le reste  d’argent  de crédit lui servira pour acheter la farine de manioc pour alimentation des enfants. En plus, elle ambitionne  augmenter son épargne et acheter une parcelle pour sa famille. La cliente salut l’initiative de Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres  femmes non bancables.
texts.en:
The customer, Djuma, is an entrepreneur and leader of the group Etoile. She is 47 years old, widowed and the mother of 7 children. Only one of her children goes to school, 4 children do not, due to a lack of financial resources, and the other 2 children have their own households. Her husband died after a sudden illness.

Djuma sells drinks (Primus beer and Fanta) from her home. She has been in this line of work for 25 years. She started her business with her own funds and later benefited from a basic loan from the MFI Hekima. She plans to use this new loan to stock up on drinks including 10 cases of Primus and 5 cases of Fanta. The rest of the loan money will be used to buy cassava flour so that she can feed her children. She also aims to build up her savings and buy a plot of land for her family.

The customer commends the initiative of Hekima and its actions in aid of impoverished, "non-bankable" women.

loans.use: to buy 10 cases of Primus and 5 cases of Fanta.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Badiatu

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Badiatu from Moriba town in the southern area of Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher, but his income is not enough to support the family. They have four children between the ages of 10 years and 19 years.

Badiatu runs a food-stand business; she sells gari (cassava flakes), palm oil and rice. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business every day and even at night; when customers want to buy she will sell. She says her business is doing well and more customers are coming. 

Badiatu has requested a loan in order to buy more palm oil, gari and rice. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her children. In the future, she plans to open a food store. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, gari (cassava flakes) and rice.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
Santa Rosa esta en el quinto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, ellas se ayudan para poder salir adelante y de esa forma ir creciendo, no solo en lo económico, sino también como personas.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Toribia,  ella tiene un  kiosko en su casa, donde vende todo tipo de productos, como ser golosinas, bebidas, y algunos comestibles. Es pequeño su negocio, pero gracias a este está ayudando a su familia y les da todo lo que necesitan.
La Sra. Toribia pide el préstamo para la compra de golosinas, y de bebidas para poder surtir su local y seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa Group is in its fifth loan cycle in the women entrepreneur's program.  The members help each other get ahead and, therefore, continue to grow not only economically but also on a personal level.

One of the members is Toribia, who runs a kiosk out of her house, where she sells all types of products such as sweets, beverages and some food items.  It is a small business, but thanks to her work she is able to help her family, giving them everything they need.

Toribia is requesting a loan to buy sweets and beverages to stock her business and continue providing her customers with all they request.

loans.use: To buy sweets and beverages.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
Kuña Kyrey se formo en la ciudad de Caaguazú, tiene  16 señoras muy trabajadoras que forman este grupo, son mujeres muy Activas.
Actualmente están en el 5to ciclo y tienen  la confianza de seguir adelante y de poder alcanzar sus metas  con el  apoyo de la Fundación Paraguaya.
Ida es parte del grupo, y es la presidenta, cuenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida, en donde trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y es por medio de ese trabajo que está saliendo adelante. Solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, panificados, verduras y demás insumos para poder seguir ofreciendo una variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Kuña Kyrey Group was formed in the city of Caaguazú, and has 16 hard-working, very active women as its members.  Currently, they are in their fifth loan cycle and are confident they will get ahead and reach their goals with the support of the Paraguaya Foundation.

Ida is a member of the group and the acting president.  She has a well-stocked store where she works every day from very early in the morning.  She is a very hard worker and has been able to get ahead through her business.  She is requesting a loan to buy milk, bakery products, vegetables and other products to continue offering variety to her customers.

loans.use: To buy milk, bakery products, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta vive en la ciudad de Santaní, ella tiene muy buen proyecto de trabajo, se dedica a la compra y ventas de pollo, y cuenta que los vende en los restaurante, comedores y otros, y es gracias a la buena calidad de su producto que esta ganándose camino.
La Sra. Marta lucha por salir adelante y ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Su sueño es poder tener algún día un propio local donde poder atender a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos, para poder seguir abasteciéndose y de esa forma que no le falte su principal producto.
texts.en:
Marta lives in the city of Santaní.  She has a very good work project and buys and sells chickens.  She sells them to restaurants, diners and other entities; and thanks to the quality of her product, she is making headway.

Marta struggles to get ahead and help her family through her work.  Her goal is to own a shop one day, and be able to attend to customers there.

She is requesting a loan to buy chickens, to keep up her supply and stay in business.

loans.use: To buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey San Juan Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Kyrey San Juan se encuentra en el 6 ciclo, y todas ellas trabajan en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también hacen trabajos juntas y así se ayudan las unas a las otras. 
La  Sra. Dora se dedica a la venta de pan, lavado de ropa y limpieza de casas, nos cuenta que gracias al apoyo de su comité  pudo mejorar su trabajo y su nivel de vida.
Ella pide el crédito para la compra de panificados y también de jabones en polvo y demás insumos. Ellas agradecen por la ayuda que están recibiendo, pues cada una está mejorando mucho.
texts.en:
The Kuña Kyrey San Juan Group is in its sixth loan cycle.  All of its members work together and supportively within the program.  In addition to each one working independently, they also work together and help each other mutually.

Dora sells bread, washes clothing and cleans houses.  She tells us that thanks to the support of the group she has been able to improve her work and lifestyle.

She is requesting a loan to buy bakery products, soap powders and other supplies.  She is grateful for the help the group is receiving, as each member is improving greatly.

loans.use: To buy bakery products and soap powders.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is from Chkhorotsku district. She is 48 years old and lives with her husband and 22-year-old son. The family is involved in agricultural business. In particular, Liana runs a small dairy farm.  She has 3 calves and 3 milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products, which is sold at the local open market. In addition, the family grows nuts on the family-owned land and sells on average 500 kg per year. They also sow maize on their agricultural land. Liana is a very hard-working woman, with a rich experience in her work.

Liana requested a loan to cultivate a plot of land and plant nut saplings. The family will do all relevant seasonal work to make a good harvest. The harvested nuts will be sold and this will increase the income for the family. The other part of the loan will be used for repairing the roof of a cattle shed. The existing one is damaged and doesn’t allow Liana to implement her future agricultural plan and expand her animal husbandry business. With the increased income, Liana will improve the living conditions for her family and insure a better future for them.

loans.use: to cultivate a plot of land, plant nut saplings and repair a cattle shed.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres forman el grupo llamado la Esperanza, están el 5to. Ciclo, y es gracias a su trabajo que están saliendo adelante. Ellas luchan por salir adelante y de esa forma también dar todo lo que pueden a sus familias.
Adelaida es una persona muy trabajadora, que desea salir adelante, es por eso que siempre se esfuerza tanto.
Ella vende cosméticos de todo tipo y ya tiene muy buena clientela, ya que es muy amable y siempre le da buena calidad a sus clientas.
Adelaida pide esta ayuda para poder comprar cosméticos, y así seguir trabajando y así tener los medios para seguir ayudando a su familia y también crecer como microemprendedora.
texts.en:
The 15 women who form the Esperanza Group are in their fifth loan cycle; and thanks to their work they are getting ahead.  They struggle to provide everything they can for their families.

Adelaida is a very hard-working person who wants to get ahead, and that is why she works so hard.  She sells all kinds of cosmetics and has a good customer base because of her kindness and quality products.

Adelaida is requesting help to buy cosmetics and continue working in order to have the means to keep supporting her family.  She also wants to grow as a small business owner.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Merisyl

texts.en:
This is Merisyl, 32, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Jay, a driver, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Merisyl operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Merisyl dreams of giving her family a good life and hopes to give her children a good and quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a widower and has two children. Currently, her two children go to school. She is blessed because despite her situation as single parent, she is still able to sustain her household expenses and send her two children to school. Sonia wants to have a better standard of living, educate her two children and have a stable source of income. To make all her dreams come true, she patiently runs her retail store and farms her two hectares of rice.

Sonia has been engaged in farming for more than five years and has run three her retail store for three years. Since she stands as father and mother to her two children, she carefully makes sure that her business improves. She plans to increase the production of rice so she can fulfill her dreams. Sonia is asking for financial assistance in the amount of PHP30,000. This loan will be used to buy farm implements and also some will be used for land preparation on her rice farm. She believes that with this loan she can provide necessary care for her rice crop. Sonia hopes for further growth of her farming and retail business.

loans.use: to buy farm equipment and for land preparation for rice farming business

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza is from the Senaki district of Georgia. She is 62 years old and lives with her husband. Roza works as a doctor at the emergency hospital and gets a monthly salary. She also is provided with a retirement pension. The family is involved in the agricultural business. Specifically, Roza runs a small dairy farm. She has a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. These cheese products are sold at the local open market. In addition, she is involved in poultry farming and sells eggs locally. The family also grows maize on the family-owned land. Roza is a very hard-working woman, with rich experience in her work.

She has applied for this loan to increase the number of cattle. With the requested loan she plans to purchase an additional milk cow. This will allow Roza to provide more milk from her dairy and increase sales. This will give her an opportunity to improve her family's living conditions. Roza awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children and they are both in school. She has three additional family members. She operates a small retail establishment at school. She has been in this business for the last 3 years. She also gets additional income from selling water. She works five days a week.  She has requested for a loan of Uganda shillings 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy sweets, cakes, boxes of biscuits, baking flour, and small packets of cooking oil. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked retail establishment and also to buy a plot of land in order to build rooms for rent. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more sweets, cakes, boxes of biscuits, baking flour and small packets of cooking oil

loans.name: Nelson

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 1 filho ainda menor de idade, vive na casa própria com  a sua família e sustenta um sobrinho que vive com ele.
É polícia de protecção e quadro do Ministério do Interior. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (portas, cimento, chapas, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa, construir um estabelecimento comercial para aumentar a renda da família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar ainda mais para aumentar a sua renda mensal.
texts.en:
Nelson is married and the father of 1 son who is still under age. He lives in his own house with his family and supports one nephew who lives with him.

He is a protection policeman and a permanent employee of the Ministry of the Interior. With this loan he intends to buy construction materials (doees, cement, metal sheets, iron and others) to continue the building work on his home.

In future he wishes to finish his house and build a commercial establishment to increase his family's income. To this end, he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to work even harder to increase his monthly income.

loans.use: buy construction materials (doees, cement, metal sheets, iron and others) to continue the building work on his home.

loans.name: Lhagvadorj

texts.en: Lkhagvadorj is 25 years old and lives with his wife and son in a Ger (which is a Mongolian yurt) in Bulgan province of Mongolia. His son goes to kindergarten. Before, he has worked in a gas station and he was a farmer. He owns 5 oxen. He is starting a business this month to sell meat in the local market. He is a hard working person who says "I have planned to expand my business in order to earn more profit and also would like to redesign my house with my business profit". He is requesting a 1,930,000MNT loan to purchase inventory for his retail meat business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his newly started retail meat business

loans.name: Nehat

texts.en:
Nehat lives in a minority community in Kosovo. He is thirty-six years old and has four children; two of whom attend school. Nehat has worked with iron as a blacksmith for more than three years. His clients are private businesses. He is known in the area for this work which makes him a lot of profit. 
Nehat started with just a welding tool and has now increased his work capacity. He is requesting a loan in order to buy iron for his work. 
This loan will help him to be better prepared for his work and provide more options for clients. He hopes in the future to increase his work capacity even more and be able to provide a better education for his children. Nehat is very thankful for this support!

loans.use: To buy iron for his work

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is a 29-year-old fruit and vegetable seller in Mariakani. She is married to Saidi and together they are blessed with three children. She has been running this business for the last six years and she is doing great.

This is her fourth loan from KADET to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase more cabbage, kale, onions, oranges, bananas and tomatoes.

She will use the proceeds to educate her children and expand her business further. She hopes to do well in the business and live a prosperous life.

loans.use: to purchase more cabbage, kale, onions, oranges, bananas and tomatoes

loans.name: Esso-Essinado Group

texts.fr: Mère de 06 enfants tous sur les bancs d’école, madame abla est née en 1969. Cultivatrice de profession, elle exerce cette activité avec 06 personnes en REGION CENTRALE  et sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter des intrants agricoles. Elle fait la culture du mais et est dans ce domaine il y a 27ans. Elle veut épargner ses revenus, assurer la scolarité des enfants tout en augmentant sa superficie cultivable. Elle est responsable du groupement nommé ESSO-ESSINADO constitué de femmes et d’hommes qui ont tous mis leur foi en la terre. Ils espèrent avec le profit augmenter leurs superficies cultivables et assurer les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en:
The mother of 6 children who all attend school, Abla was born in 1969. She is a farmer and farms in the central region, together with 6 other people. She is requesting her first loan so that she can buy agricultural inputs. She has been farming corn for 27 years. She would like to save her income, provide for her children's education and expand her farmland.

Abla is the leader of the "Esso-Essinado" group which is made up of men and women who have all put their faith into farming the land. They hope to use their profits to expand their farmland and take care of their family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Dinine Dama Group

texts.fr: Agriculteur de profession depuis 1990, Tchamdja né en 1963 a pour conjointe une ménagère. Ils ont 11 enfants dont 10 sur les bancs d’école. Le premier a 22ans et le dernier 06ans. Il est à son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES et ce prêt lui servira à acheter des intrants agricoles afin d’avoir un bon rendement. Notons qu’il est nommé pour être le responsable de leur groupement qui a pour nom « DININE DAMA » constitué de femmes et d’hommes qui ont mis leur foi en la terre,ils espèrent avec les profits, réinvestir dans l’activité et assurer la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
A farmer since 1990, Tchamdja was born in 1963 and his spouse is a housewife. The couple have 11 children, 10 of whom attend school. The eldest is 22 years old and the youngest, 6.

This will be Tchamdja's first loan cycle with WAGES and the loan will be used to buy agricultural inputs in order to make sure his crops perform well. He has been nominated as the leader of the group called "Dinine Dama", which is made up of men and women who have put their faith into farming the land. They hope to use their profits to reinvest in their businesses and provide for their families' care.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crates of tomatoes and bags of palm nuts and vegetables.

loans.name: Amador Roque

texts.es:
Roque vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago, entre otros. Roque es padre soltero, debido a circunstancias ajenas tuvo que convertirse en padre y madre para sus 2 hijos, los cuales tiene actualmente 18 y 6 años y por quienes lucha cada día para poder convertirlos en personas de bien y sobre todo sean mejores que el. Roque trabaja día a día como obrero en un fundo de su ciudad, con lo cual puede solventar con mucho esfuerzo los gastos de su hogar; el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias y él cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y ser un orgullo para sus hijos.

Roque está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras a su vivienda en especial poder mejorar el cuarto de su hijo el cual tiene la pared rajada, así como también poder comprar una cama ya que actualmente no tiene, de esta manera podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Roque lives in the city of Ica which is known for having a warm and welcoming climate and agricultural development, especially the cultivation of cotton and asparagus, among others.  Roque is a single father.  Due to strange circumstances he had to become the father and mother for his two children, who are now 6 and 18 years old and for whom he fights for day in and day out in order to turn them into good people who are above all, better off than he is.

Roque works every day as a laborer on an estate in his city. With this job he is able to settle the expenses of his home with a lot of effort.  He works around eight hours a day and believes his job is going well because he is very friendly with the clients and above all, because he is very determined to get ahead in life and to be a source of pride for his children.

Roque is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have offered he will be able to make improvements to his house, specifically to improve his son's room which has a cracked wall and also to buy a bed since he doesn't have one right now.  In this way he will be able to offer a better quality of life to his children and continue fighting every day to be able to realize his greatest dream: To have his own house.

loans.use: to repair a wall and to buy a bed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for clothes selling business

loans.name: Primicia Group

texts.es:
El comité "Primicia"lleva mas de 4 años de trabajo juntas y también de trabajo con la Fundación, y gracias a esta unión se están ayudando las unas a las otras.
La Sra. Karina es una de las integrantes de éste comité , se unió por la necesidad de tener una ayuda que le permita ganar mas ingresos y así ayudar a su familia. Karina es vendedora de ropas y cosméticos en forma ambulante y cuenta que anhela un futuro mejor para su hijo es por eso que se esfuerza todos los días para darles la oportunidad de estudiar.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas y también de cosméticos para poder seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The Primicia Group has spent more than four years working together and of also working with the Foundation, and thanks to this union they are helping each other.

Señora Karina is one of the members of this group.  She joined out of the necessity of having support that would allow her to earn more income and thus help her family.  Karina sells clothing and cosmetics on the street and says that she longs for a better future for her son.  It is for this reason that she exerts herself everyday in order to give him the opportunity to study.

She asks for the loan in order to buy garments and cosmetics to be able to continue working and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy garments and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a 44-year-old living in Masindi, Uganda. She is a widow and charged with the responsibility of taking care of 3 children. After the death of her husband she realized that farming alone could not help her support her family since it was seasonal, so she ventured into cloth selling. With the income earned she has been able to pay school fees for her children and renovate her house.

Like most traders in a developing world she has challenges of high taxes and price fluctuation. Harriet's goal is to educate her children up to the university level and move the business to a more permanent location. Harriet intends to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

She roasts sausages and chicken at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She also gets additional income from plaiting hair. She works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy packets of sausages and chicken. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to start poultry farming and to build her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more packets of sausages and chicken for roasting

loans.name: Mazera

texts.en:
Mazera is a married man with one son who is currently enrolled in school. He has been selling clothes for several years before he diverted to the current business. Mazera is currently involved in food vending selling cashew nuts, ground nuts and other food stuffs. He sells them at the nearby market.

He has shown great desire to move forward. He says that he is on a merry-go-round and plans to invest the money he will receive when it reaches his turn.

With this loan, Mazera plans to buy more stock of ground nuts, cashew nuts, etc.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ground nuts, cashew nuts, etc.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
La educación es la base principal para el desarrollo de un país y es por este motivo que hoy en día se requieren maestros muy capaces y con altos conocimientos en la materia. Consciente de esto,  la señora Ana se dedica a laborar como maestra en una comunidad del  municipio de Telica atendiendo niños de varias edades y cuya preocupación principal es la educación en estas personas ya que son el futuro de la nación.

Ella acude a Ceprodel porque requiere solicitar un crédito para el mejoramiento de su vivienda y para ello comprará Bloques, Cemento, Hierro 3/8, Hierro ¾, Zinc, Arena y Alfajillas, para construir pared y techo.   Cabe señalar que Ceprodel se ha caracterizado por apoyar a estos maestros que sin duda contribuyen al desarrollo de los pequeños, y por ende al desarrollo de la familia, en su caso, mejora las condiciones y nivel de vida efectuando las mejoras en su vivienda, y de esa manera crear mejores condiciones en su familia, agradeciéndole a  ceprodel por darle la oportunidad de ser beneficiada y lograr subsanar la necesidad prioritaria de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Education is the main foundation for the development of a country, and it is for this reason that countries today require very capable teachers with a high level of knowledge in their subjects.  Conscious of this, Ana makes a living as a teacher in a community in the municipality of Telica, attending to children of various ages.  Her main concern is the education of these individuals who are the future of the nation.

She comes to Ceprodel because she needs to apply for a loan for the improvement of her home.  She will buy cinder blocks, cement, 3/8" iron bars, 3/4" iron bars, corrugated tin roofing panels, sand, and wooden boards to construct a wall and roof.  It should be noted that Ceprodel has been known to support teachers who, without a doubt, contribute to the development of children, and therefore to the development of the family.  

In her case, she improves her conditions and standard of living by making improvements to her home, and thus creates better conditions for her family.  

She thanks Ceprodel for giving her the opportunity to receive a loan, and to make the improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, cement, 3/8" diameter iron bars, 3/4" diameter iron bars, corrugated roofing panels, sand, and wooden boards for the construction of a wall and roof.

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Japheth is a determined man who always looks for opportunities to succeed in life. He is married and lives with his life partner and three children in the suburban area of Kisauni. 

For the last two years, Japheth has earned a living by operating a motorcycle taxi. It should be noted that this is the only source of income for the family since his wife takes care of the house and children.

Japheth is requesting this loan to service his motorcycle taxi so that he can provide efficient services. He will also buy spare parts.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle taxi and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Costance

texts.en:
Costance is a 39-year-old married woman living in Masindi, Uganda. For 10 years Costance has been operating a bar and business selling plastic shoes. She started with 200,000 Ugandan shillings that was given to her by her husband as her startup capital and now her stock is worth 5 million shillings. Seasonal weather and inadequate capital to purchase stock hinders her business.

Costance’s dream is to educate children, build a permanent home and expand her business into new markets. She is requesting a loan to buy crates of soda and plastic shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda and plastic shoes to sell

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy, age 25, is a single gentleman who has decided to start a retail shop. He saw the need to do so because there is a demand for goods that most of the existing kiosks do not stock. By starting his own retail shop, Kennedy anticipates achieving good results. He needs to continue helping his parents, even as he meets his daily needs. 

However, since Kennedy does not have enough capital to do this, he is requesting a loan in the amount of KES 20,000 to buy stock of items such as bales of flour, rice, beans and other fast-selling consumer products.

loans.use: to buy stock of items such as bales of flour, rice, beans and other fast-selling consumer products.

loans.name: Jale

texts.en:
Jale is a 35-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has four children between the ages of 4 and 13. All of them go to school.

Jale runs a general store, and has been in this business for three years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. He is taking a loan of 4000 SDG to purchase maize flour, etc. for his store. He has no other source of income.

In five years, Jale would like to expand his business and open other branches.

His major business challenge is high market prices.

Jale says he is thankful to receive this loan given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items such as maize flour, etc.

loans.name: Nazmi

texts.en:
Nazmi is 67 years old and comes from Kosovo. He is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. 

Nazmi has his own business as a taxi driver and possesses the appropriate license to operate as such. He is very diligent and attentive to both the requirements for operating his business and in his work ethic. These characteristics have helped him to have a large number of return customers who continue to use his services. 

In the beginning, Nazmi started to work as a local taxi driver and now he also accommodates long trips. Nazmi is in need of a loan in order to buy new tires and repair his vehicle. This loan will help him to improve the working conditions of his transportation business and therefore his income. In the future, he hopes to increase his income even more and offer a better life for his family.

He wants to thank all lenders!

loans.use: To buy tires and repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Jazzillah

texts.en:
Jazzillah is a hardworking married woman with two children. She and her family live in Masindi, Uganda. She is a teacher. 

With her savings, Jazzillah has been able to invest in the transport sector by buying a motorcycle. She rents the motorcycle to riders who remit 80 percent of their daily earnings. She says the business has been very lucrative and she wants to buy five more motorcycles so as to increase her income.

Her greatest challenges include high fuel costs and mechanical breakdowns. Her personal goal is to educate her children at the university level. She also wants to upgrade her studies so she can attract a promotion and thus earn a higher salary.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali is from the Senaki district of West Georgia. She is 60 years old and lives with her mother and two grown children. The family is involved in agriculture. They run a small dairy business, with two calves, and two milk cows producing milk for dairy products. Dali produces cheese and sells it at the local open market.  In addition, they grow maize on family-owned land. Part of the harvest is sold at the local open market, and the rest is used for family needs. Dali works hard, but the family still doesn’t have enough income to make it possible to save and improve the family's living conditions.

She requested a loan to build a shed and to buy pigs. Dali will purchase the construction materials for a new shed. After the pigs are raised, the family will sell piglets, and this will increase the family income. With the increased income, Dali will be able to expand her animal husbandry business and use the profits for house renovation.

loans.use: to build a shed and purchase pigs to raise.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda used her previous loan to buy iron sheets, sand, and cement to construct her residential house. She is a 31 year old married lady with three children, living in Kagadi, Uganda. She is a teacher by profession and has been working for seven years. She would like to educate her children, buy a car and build a permanent house, while her business dream is to engage in commercial farming. Imelda is requesting a loan to buy land to grow crops.

loans.use: to buy land to grow crops.

loans.name: Igimbi Agahikaine Group

texts.en: Yosia is a married man, aged 50, who owns a produce store that he has run for 7 years. He got start-up capital from brick laying. Inadequate capital is affecting his business.  He would like to expand his business to other areas within the district and to educate his eight children. He is a member of Igimbi Agahikaine group, where each member guarantees the other. Yosia is requesting a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Doucette Nathalie

texts.fr: Doucette est une femme de 27 ans mariée, mère de deux enfants de de 2 et 3 ans. Elle est commerçante et a ouvert une petite boutique qu'elle dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 1 an. C'est grace à cette activité qu'elle aide son époux à s'occuper de leur famille. Ses relations de bon voisinnage, son acceuil lui permis d'agrandir sa clientèle au fil du temps. Elle a juste un problème dû à son capital qui n'est pas assez important pour augmenter les stocks de marchandises dans sa boutique et éviter les petites ruptures de stocks d'où la necessité de ce crédit qui lui permettra d'acheter les produits de premières necessité(es produits de première necessité (sac de riz, sel, carton de savons, sucre...) . Elle réinvestira une partie de ces bénefices pour agrandir son activité le resta lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens.
texts.en: Doucette is 27 years old, married, and the mother of two children, aged two and three years.  She is a vendor and opened a small shop in a district of the capital a year ago.  Because of this work she is able to assist her husband with taking care of their family.  Her neighborly relations and her warmth have helped her customer base to grow with time.  Her only problem is that she does not have enough funds to increase the stock of merchandise for her shop to avoid running out of certain items.  This is why she needs a loan which will allow her to buy basic products (sacks of rice, salt, cases of soap, sugar, etc.).  She will reinvest a part of her profits to grow her business, and the rest will allow her to meet her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy basic grocery products (sacks of rice, salt, cases of soap, sugar, etc.).

loans.name: Matrushakti Group

texts.en:
Sumati is a married woman of 38 years who lives in a remote rural village named Torli in the Nuapada district in Odisha, India. The prime income source of that locality is cultivation. This village is far away from education, sanitation, advanced facilities, etc. 

The lady standing second from left in the pink sari with raised hand is Sumati. She lives with five family members consisting of her husband; two sons, aged 15 and 13; and one daughter, 5 years of age. Her children are continuing study in school. She is a very kind-hearted person, hardworking and enthusiastic, who always devotes her efforts to getting her family ahead. 
 
For 13 years, Sumati has been running a general grocery shop. Initially, she started the business in a low profile with limited items like potatoes, soap, sugar, tea dust, tobacco, chocolates, etc. Gradually, she expanded her business and added extra items regularly. Due to her good behavior, her business has grown rapidly. 

In the year 2008, with her able leadership, Sumati, along with other three women of her small village, formed a Joint Liability Group named Matrushakti, which means “mother’s power,” to take loans from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their businesses. All members hail from poor backgrounds in the "below poverty line" category. 

This is the fourth loan of her group. During the last three loans, Sumati has been able to add some grocery items like dough, vegetables, oil, spices, soda (soft drinks) etc. and also a refrigerator for her shop. Every day from the early morning she starts her work at a stretch of ten hours. Now she is earning 500 INR daily from her business. 

Sumati wants to keep more stock for her shop but, due to financial scarcity, her husband has to go to the nearest market to buy items for her grocery shop regularly. Due to frequent purchases, she incurred losses in transportation. So from the present loan she has planned to buy merchandise for her business such as rice, sugar, vegetables, oil, noodles, potato, onion, dough, soda, etc., in bulk. She expects to increase her sales and, thereby, her income, which will serve to ensure the education and welfare of her children. 
 
Sumati hopes to build a permanent cabin in the center of her village for running her business. She also hopes to provide better education to her children. 

The other three members of the group are Ghame, Jayantidei and Santi running spice-selling and milk-selling businesses.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing of grocery items in bulk.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita is a 56 year old married woman with three grown children from Baclayon, Bohol, Philippines. She has run a sari-sari (convenience) store for more than twenty years. Pedrita sells various items, such as eggs, chips, soda and snack foods to the people in her community. She also cooks and sells food at her town's public school.
Pedrita is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell, such as snack foods, soda, biscuits, etc.
Pedrita dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional mechandise to sell, such as snack foods, soda, and biscuits.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan, which she used buy additional stocks of car accessories and other products needed for her car wash business. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and with their personal, household, and business expenses. 

She would like to apply for another loan, of 12,000 PHP, to use to purchase more products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her car wash business is still existing and growing. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and meet the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial improvement with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Teresita dreams to have a good future and hopes to give her children a quality education. She never fails to attend the fellowship* meeting every week, as it inspires her to become a better person by studying the word of God and sharing His goodness with everyone.
  
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Luque, 17 mujeres decidieron unirse y trabajar juntas, de allí surge el grupo Virgen del Rosario. La Sra. Maria, la presidenta,  se dedica a la venta de comestible y bebidas, esta casada con el señor Marcelino, con quien tiene  3 hijos. Nos cuenta que ambos se ayudan mutuamente para salir adelante y así dar una vida a sus hijos y demás familiares.
 Ella solicitó  el crédito  para la compra bebidas, como ser gaseosa, cerveza de todas las marcas y demás tipos. Ella tiene como meta implementar mas productos en su negocio, y así tener mas clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of Luque, seventeen women decided to unite and work together, forming the group Virgen del Rosario [Our Lady of the Rosary].  Maria, the president, makes a living selling food and drinks, and is married to Marcelino.  Together they have three children.  She tells us that together they help one another to continue moving forward and thereby give a good life to their children and other relatives.

She is requesting a loan to buy drinks such as soda, all brands of beer, and other types.  She has a goal to offer more products at her shop, and therefore have more customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks to sell.

loans.name: Maha Laxmi Group

texts.en:
Maha Laxmi Joint Liability Group was formed in the year 2010. This group is located in the village of Padampur in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India. Vegetable cultivation and vending is the primary source of livelihood of most of the families of this village.  

This group consists of five members from the "below poverty line" category, and Gua is one of them. The lady standing second from the left in the photo with raised hand is Gua. She is 40 years old and has a family of five: her husband and three sons, age 28, 26 and 24, who help in her business.
 
Gua has a vegetable cultivation farm and vegetable vending business that she manages together with her husband and sons. She grows vegetables like brinjal, cauliflower, carrots, cabbage, chilli, ladies finger, etc., in her farm. She sells her produce wholesale to the traders of the nearby market and also sells personally in her retail outlet. She earns a minimum of 400 INR per day, which is insufficient to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family as well as the farm expenses. 

Gua wants to expand her business by taking a fresh loan. This is her third loan and she will use it to buy fertilizer and farm inputs like seeds and pesticides for her farm. She expects a good return from her business by expanding her cultivation.

Gua dreams to construct a house as she is planning for the marriage of her son in the near future. She also hopes to give her whole family a bright future through her hard work.
 
The other four members of this group are Banita, Mukta, Nrupa and Shanti, who have vegetable cultivation, vending and tent-house businesses.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing of fertilizer, pesticides and seeds.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married, with three children, all of whom go to school. She has two additional family members (elderly  parents). 

She sells second hand clothes at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this  business for the past two years. She works six days a week.  

Irene has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to start importing used clothes and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. 

She lives in a  rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.fr:
Madame Josiane, âgée de 45 ans, s’active dans la restauration depuis plus de dix ans. Elle a choisi le métier par amour, la preuve, elle y passe toute la journée. Elle vend le petit déjeuner et des jus de fruits. Elle a aménagé un coin chez elle pour y installer une table et y mettre le nécessaire pour son activité. Il faut noter qu’il lui arrive de vendre aussi des tissus pour diversifier. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter les condiments dont elle a besoin en quantité suffisante. Aussi bien pour la restauration, que  pour les jus de fruits
 Madame Josiane est divorcée et c’est  elle qui s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de ses enfants.
Elle travaille afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vies de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josiane, 45, has been in the restaurant business for more than ten years.  She chose this work because she loves it, and proves that by spending her whole day at it. She sells breakfast and fruit juices.  She has set up in a place in her home with a table and equipment necessary for her business.  It should also be mentioned that she sells fabric as a sideline.  She is requesting this loan to buy food items that she needs, in sufficient quantities, for serving food and for making juices. 
Mrs. Josiane is divorced and therefore she alone takes care of the daily expenses of her children.
She works in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy food items such as onions, pepper, garlic, oil, sugar, and baobob fruit, for food service and juice making.

loans.name: Jay Maa Dasaren Group

texts.en:
Puspanjali, an active married lady of 30, is a resident of a rural village called Nehna in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India. Nuapada is one of the poorest and least developed districts with 85% rural population. The smiling lady standing second from the right with raised hand in the blue sari is Puspanjali. 
She resides with her husband, two sons, age 10 and 8, and one daughter, age 2.

She and her husband have operated a fancy store for the last 10 years and work hard continuously to meet their day-to-day expenses.
Puspanjali’s business is basically a small general store with retail groceries, beverages, lady fancy items, stationery, chocolates, etc. There is a girls' school near her store and mostly girl students come to her store to purchase fancy items and stationery. 

She gets the supplies at wholesale prices from the nearest market and sells the items with a minimal profit. Puspanjali gets a monthly income of 3,000 INR from the present business, which makes it very hard for Puspanjali to manage her family. Due to financial constraints she cannot store more items and has to face losses due to frequent purchase of items and transportation. 

To increase the income of her family, in the year 2010 Puspanjali, along with other three like-minded women of her village, formed a group named Maa Dasaren. Puspanjali wants to use the present loan for purchasing more items like hair bands, ribbons, talcum powder, bangles, pens, pencils, etc.

Puspanjali hopes with confidence to give a better education to her children and dreams to construct a pucca (permanent) house to have a good life through all her hard work in her business.

The other three energetic group members are Banita, Minakshi and Damayanti who are doing tailoring and milk businesses.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing of talcum powder, bangles, cosmetics, stationery, etc.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
For the past six years, Gilbert has been a well-known supplier of breads to the retailers, since he sells as wholesale. 

He is a married man living with his wife and two children in the municipality of Mommbasa. His personal desire is to have his own residential house, since he currently lives in a rental house. Gilbert also dreams of expanding his outlets and increasing sales.

He is requesting this loan to buy more stocks of breads at wholesale so that he can sell more. He hopes to have good results out of this investment.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bread.

loans.name: Maa Banji Buten Group

texts.en:
Surekha is standing at the extreme right in the photo with a raised hand. She is 35, a resident of the village of Padampur in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India. Vegetable cultivation and vending are the main work of most of the families of this village. Surekha is a married woman and is the mother of three daughters, age 16, 14 and 12, and one son, age 4. 

Surekha, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. Currently, she is working hard to continuously  provide income for their day-to-day expenses. 

Surekha operates a vegetable growing farm with her husband. She grows vegetables like brinjal, cauliflower, carrots, cabbages, chilli, ladies finger, etc., on their farm located in the same village. She sells her products wholesale to the traders of the nearby market as well as to the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 INR per day. Apart from vegetable farming, she has a small general grocery shop in her house to add some extra income to her family.  

In the year 2009 Surekha, with other three women of her village, formed a group named “Maa Banji Buten” and the group has already taken three loans from Mahashakti Foundation to help continue their businesses. This is their fourth loan and Surekha will use a part of the present loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs like seeds and pesticides. The rest will be used for purchasing grocery items like potatoes, onions, sugar, tea dust, etc. She expects a boom in her income as she expands her businesses.

Surekha has a dream to give her whole family a good future through her hard work. She also dreams to procure some assets for the marriage of her daughters.  

The other three co-members of her group are Nirupama, Gomati and Tulasi. The have an auto-repairing center, a general grocery shop and a vegetable cultivation business.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing of fertilizer, pesticides, seeds, etc., as well as items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 30-year-old married woman from Maribojoc, Bohol. She has four children, ages nine, six, four, and three years. 

She has been in the sari-sari store business for two years. Each month, Evangeline earns five thousand pesos by doing the sari-sari store business. She sells merchandise like rice, soft drinks, and canned goods. Her husband is a motorcycle driver who helps finance their daily needs. 

Evangeline is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy two sacks of rice, soft drinks, and canned goods. Evangeline would like to expand her business to enhance their status of living, at the same time supporting her four children's studies.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice, soft drinks, and canned goods.

loans.name: Otgonhishig

texts.en:
Otgonhishig is 48 years old, married, and has two children who attend school.  They live in a small house in Hovd province, Mongolia. His wife works as chef. Otgonbileg is an experienced driver who has worked as a driver in a public transportation company for many years. 

Otgonhishig is requesting a loan for 2,000,000 MNT, which he will use to buy a minibus for his public transportation service business. He is planning to start his own public transportation service business.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus for his public transportation service business.

loans.name: Zily

texts.en:
Ms Zily is a 50-year-old married woman. She is been in the beauty parlor business for seven years. She offers many facilities to her customers. Through providing her best services, she became famous on her street. As her customers' demand is increasing day by day, she is interested in buying a greater variety of cosmetics products for the parlor. 

Now, however, she is facing the financial problem of low cash in hand. This compelled her to contact Kashf Foundation to apply for her first loan. 

She needs a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater more customers at a time. With the help of the loan, she will not only purchase a variety of products but will also able to meet her household expenditures.

loans.use: To buy hair care products, skin products, and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru:
Абдурахмон житель города Дангара. Ему 45 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей, трое сыновей и трое дочерей. Старший сын Абдурахмона находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, дочь замужем, а четверо других детей учатся в школе.
Абдурахмон имеет средне - специальное образование, он шафер. По специальности Абдурахмон несколько лет как не работает. Он более шести лет зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Абдурахмон разводит скот у себя дома. Он создал хорошие условия для животноводство. 
Абдурахмон просит кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en:
Abdurahmon lives in the town of Dangara. He is 45 years old. He is married and has six children: three sons and three daughters. The eldest son temporarily works in the Russian Federation; one daughter is married; and four other children are still in secondary school.

Abdurahmon has received a technical education. He is a driver. It has been several years since he stopped working in his profession. For over six years, he has been raising cattle. Abdurahmon raises cattle near his home. He has created good conditions for his livestock.
Abdurahom is requesting a credit in order to buy  some bull calves.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora se forma gracias a que 11 mujeres decidieron trabajar juntas y de esa forma ayudarse las unas a las otras y dar a sus familias todo lo que necesitan.
Benicia tiene una carnicería donde surte a las personas de su barrio y les da todo tipo de cortes de carne. Ella se define como una mujer que desea progresar y ayudar a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes de primera, para que de esa forma siga dando una buena variedad a sus clientes y que no le falte el producto para seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora group exists because eleven women decided to work together and help each other to provide their families with their every need.
Benicia has a meat shop where she supplies her neighbours with all varieties of cuts of meat. She describes herself as a woman who wants to get ahead and help her family.
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of meat so that she can continue providing her clients with a good variety and so that she will not run out of products, so that she can continue to sell.

loans.use: to buy cuts of meat for sale.

loans.name: Bador Group

texts.en:
This group is called Bador and is comprised of four ladies. They applied for a loan of 80,000 Yemeni Rial (YER). 

Hanan lives in Hodeida, Yemen. She is the second woman on the right in the photo. She is 24 years old and single. 

She has been selling clothes and incense for ladies. She is a professional in this field and her goods are required in the market. She started her business with little capital. 

Hanan is applying for a youth loan of 20,000 YER to buy clothes. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand her business and improve the living standards of the family. Her dream is to expand her business in order to sell different products.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children. and two go to school. She has two additional family members (mother and father). 

She sells green bananas at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She also owns a motorcycle where she earns additional income.  She has been in her business for the past 10 years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested  a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality. 

Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and to build a house. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en:
Sesilia is 41 years old and married, with four children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, and yams so she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Sesilia needs a loan to buy another wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, some bush knives, weed-killer spray, and more tiapula and to pay her children's school fees. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Sesilia will use the profits from her sales to improve her family assets.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, shovel, rake, bush knives, and weed killer.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.
